names.pharmaceuticalLatin: Fructus Oryzae Germinatus Fructus Setariae Germinatus

action.primary: Reduces Food Stagnation, promotes digestion, strengthens and descends Qi, opens the Stomach and harmonizes the Center

indications: Food Stagnation due to undigested starchy foods
Food Stagnation due to Spleen Qi Deficiency

action.primary: Strengthens the Spleen and encourages appetite

contraindications: Long-term use may injure the Kidneys.

useCases: Reduced appetite and distention of the chest and abdomen due to Food Stagnation.
Poor digestion due to Spleen and Stomach Deficiency.
Poor digestion with decreased food intake and diarrhea due to Spleen and Stomach Deficiency.
